Row.Text: Requires no [ICON_GOLD] Gold maintenance.

Odeon
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]Odeon
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](PL_PL text) [ENDCOLOR]Odeon
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR]Odeon

The Odeon is a building unique to the Greeks, replacing the Amphitheater. It increases the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture of a city, speeding the growth of the city's territory and the civilization's acquisition of Social Policies, and also advances your scientific goals by providing +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science. Additionally, unlike the Amphitheater, the Odeon has no maintenance cost. The city must contain a Monument before the Odeon can be constructed. Contains 1 slot for a Great Work of Writing.

Additionally, unlike the Amphitheater, the Odeon has no maintenance cost. The city must contain a Monument before the Odeon can be constructed. Contains 1 slot for a Great Work of Writing.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR]The Odeon is a building unique to the Greeks, replacing the Amphitheater. It increases the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture of a city, speeding the growth of the city's territory and the civilization's acquisition of Social Policies, and also advances your scientific goals by providing +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science. Additionally, unlike the Amphitheater, the Odeon has no maintenance cost. The city must contain a Monument before the Odeon can be constructed. Contains 1 slot for a Great Work of Writing.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Source: Civilization IV - Civilopedia entry[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Modern western drama was created in Greece around 530 BC, evolving from the "dithyramb," a fertility ritual of songs, poems and dances offered to the Greek god Dionysus. An "Odeon" is a large, open-aired structure in which such performances were held. The audience sat in a semicircle of seats around a central paved "dancing square" (orchestra). The first row of seats was reserved for important officials or priests. There was usually an altar dedicated to Dionysus somewhere in the odeon. The "logeion" was a small raised platform where the performers acted (the original dramas had at most three or four actors; the size of the stage would increase as later plays required bigger casts).

The "logeion" was a small raised platform where the performers acted (the original dramas had at most three or four actors; the size of the stage would increase as later plays required bigger casts).

Military Units may enter City-State borders freely. City-State [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence degrades at half and recovers at twice the normal rate. Completing City-State quests provides 25% more [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence.
